current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title 38, United States Code, to require a
		  program of mental health care and rehabilitation for veterans for
		  service-related post-traumatic stress disorder, depression, anxiety disorder,
		  or a related substance use disorder, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Veterans Mental Health Treatment
			 First Act of 2013

			 the

			 disorder

shall
				provide for each veteran who participates in the program under this section a
				treatment regimen and rehabilitation plan for the post-traumatic stress
				disorder, depression, anxiety disorder, or related substance use disorder of
				such veteran as described in

. The treatment regimen and
				rehabilitation plan shall be devised by appropriate clinicians and other
				appropriate personnel of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Veterans Mental Health Treatment First Act of 2013/s:1712C/ss:a/p:3

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: assigned for that purpose.

text.#text: The

The treatment regimen and
				rehabilitation plan for a veteran under this subsection shall include such
				mental health care and rehabilitation as the clinicians and other personnel
				concerned consider appropriate for the remediation of the condition or
				conditions of the veteran covered by the plan.

The duration of each treatment
				regimen and rehabilitation plan under this subsection shall be such period as
				the clinician concerned considers appropriate.
